snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton said she used a personal email address while she was secretary of state as a matter of convenience and that she “fully complied with every rule.”
abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton, in news conference about her exclusive use of private email account while secretary of state, says she 'fully complied with every rule' and turned over to State Dept emails concerning government business; says she deleted emails about private matters.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton said she used a personal email address while she was secretary of state as a matter of convenience and that she “fully complied with every rule.”

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Tries to Quell Controversy Over Private Email
headline.print_headline: Clinton Says She Followed Rules on Email
